Description: Papyrus (seven fragments); Demotic legal text recto; list of witnesses verso; also eight small fragments framed separately.
Curator's comments: Depuydt L, 1996, in Fs. Simpson, p181 Being worked on by Jannik Korte (Heidelberg)
To be included in the 'Musee achemenide virtuel et interactif' (see www.achemenet.com).

Published: A. F. Shore, 'Swapping Property at Asyut in the Persian Period' in J. Baines et al. (ed.), Pyramid Studies and Other Essays Presented to I. E. S. Edwards (EES Occasional Publications 7, London 1988), 200-6.

No acquisition details are recorded, apart from a comment in the registers 'incorporated into the collection after reassembly and repair'. According to Shore's remarks EA 10792 was 'identified among unaccessioned material .. in 1960', then conserved by Stanley Baker and then registered (see bibliography for EA 10792), and the same is presumably true of the group EA 10787-92.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (48701) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/48701)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: brittle, fractured, frayed, insect attack, loss Black ink (loss) Red ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
